PyHPC.PyHPC_System.simulation_management.InitCon#

class PyHPC.PyHPC_System.simulation_management.InitCon(name, raw, parent=None)[source]#

The InitCon object is a container for an initial condition file (typically a .dat or .g2 file). These form the individual sub-units of the SimulationLog object and can be accessed using the SimulationLog.ics method.

—

Formatting:

```json ‘<initial_condition_file_path>’: {

“information”: “<user input information>”, “meta”: {

“dateCreated”: “”, “lastEdited”: “”, “<further meta data>”: “”

}, “simulations”: {

“<simulation 1>”: {

“keys”: “values”

}

}, “core”: { }

}

```

Methods

__init__(name, raw[, parent])

add(entries[, auto_save, force])

adds the entry contained in **kwargs to the InitCon object.

delete()

log(message, action[, auto_save])

logs the message to the self.raw.action_log.

save()

to_html(output)

Writes the init_log to a system of html files at the output location.

Attributes

core

self.core contains all of the core information for this entry.

inf

self.inf contains all of the description information for this entry.

listed

meta

self.meta contains all of the meta information for this entry.

sims

self.sims contains all of the SimRec objects in the simulation.

parent

self.parent is a reference to the parent object.

name

self.name contains the key value of the entry in the SimulationLog object.

raw

self.raw is the core information in the InitCon object.
